conversations.content: Aeleen is a warrior. And while her soul is kind, when she gets into a fight...
YOU ARE ALL GOING TO DIIIIIE!
Er, well, she tends to lose her temper—hence her reputation as a warrior with whom one does not want to pick a fight. But the way of war was not always her chosen life's pursuit...
You want to become a NURSE?!
Yes. It's long been a dream of mine.
Why are you all looking at me like that? Is it really such a strange request?
N-not at all! It just comes as something of a surprise, is all.
We certainly aren't thinking that nurse is a WILDLY inappropriate profession for one of your temperament.
Er, maybe you should take a step back and tell us where this idea came from.
I suppose I DID spring it on you out of the blue...
Well, as you know, I currently follow the path of the warrior.
But ever since I was young, I've always wanted to be a nurse.
A kindly one who can see people through sickness and help with their injuries.
There was a hospital in my hometown, so I'm quite familiar with nurses and the important work they do.
I often saw them walking around in their spotless white coats—it seemed every child looked up to them.
Sounds like quite the popular profession. But if that was your dream, how did you end up becoming a warrior?
My village's vigilante militia apparently thought I had what it took.
I couldn't bring myself to turn them down when they asked me to join, and before I knew it, I'd been with them for years.
That's surprising. I figured you became a warrior by choice, not because others had to talk you into it.
Still, it's easy to see why they pursued you. You possess a natural talent for combat.
However, it is very Aeleen for you to have fought this whole time while also being rather opposed to the entire enterprise.
Oh, I don't regret becoming a warrior.
I've been able to protect a lot of important things as a result, which is great.
Still, this castle has plenty of warriors.
So I thought now would be a good time to try and achieve my true dream.
Well, I think it's a fine idea.
You have my full support.
I, for one, would love some help dealing with the injured in our makeshift infirmary.
You're very knowledgeable on medical herbs, so I know you'll be a fine asset.
Thank you, everyone. I won't let you down!
Truthfully, I've long thought that I'd be better suited to medical arts than combat!
Oh dear. You're looking at me again.
N-no we're not! We're just, um... Hahaha...
We're all very happy for you, Aeleen.
However, if you plan to start this new path in your life, I have a little present to help get you started.
A present?
Several days later...
Can I come in?
Of course.
W-well? What do you think?
I think it suits you perfectly.
Thank you! I felt like a real nurse the moment I put it on.
Now I can finally get down to the business of healing!
It will certainly put patients more at ease than if you did your rounds in armor.
Still, as nursing is traditionally a human profession, I had to copy other uniforms while making it, so I'm glad you like it.
Like I said, I won't let you down!
I'm going to be a kindly nurse who supports everyone from the sidelines!
We can't wait to see you in action.
Graaaaagh!
PERISH IN BLOOD, FELL BEAST!
...Graaagh?
I'm in the middle of seeing a patient here, but I guess I'll just have to bump YOU up to the front of the line!
Graaagh! Nyaaargh!
Er, wasn't the plan to be a kindly nurse who stayed on the sidelines...?
*pant* *pant* ...Oh no. I did it again.
You suggested the other day that you are not truly suited to the rigors of battle, but I do not believe that is the case.
I don't think there are many others who could be so deadly with a staff...
It just startled me is all!
Give me another chance! Please! I KNOW I can learn to be kind!
Euden! Wake up! It's morning already!
Mmm? Oh, good morning, Notte. Geez, it sure is cold toda—WAAA-CHOOO!
Uh oh. That doesn't sound good. ...Ack! Your forehead is burning up!
You need a nurse, stat. I'm gonna get Aeleen.
...I'm afraid you've caught a cold.
Then I'll just have to tough it out.
Oh no you don't, bub! You need rest and recovery!
Indeed, colds are not to be taken lightly. So today, I am going to act as your own personal nurse.
But...
This is my JOB, sir! Leave it to me!
Well, if you say so...
Now then, these three medicines are for your fever, so I need you to take them all.
Er, it's a pretty low-grade fever. Won't one medicine be enough?
I've made these from a variety of different herbs. Take them all, and your naughty fever will be a thing of the past!
This still feels like too much...
Obey your nurse!
All right, all right! Down the hatch...
Oh dear—look how much you're sweating. I'll change these sheets at once.
But you've changed them twice already...
You're in no condition to bathe yourself. You must allow me to help you.
Ack, no! I'm fine! Seriously!
Next, I must put fresh water in his room...
Now I need to get the medicine ready...
Uh, Elly? Why ya givin' Aeleen the evil eye every time she comes by?
While I appreciate the woman's dedication to her craft, I think she is...overdoing it.
Bwaaa ha ha! Yer JEALOUS!
I am NOT jealous! ...Merely concerned.
Elisanne?
Aeleen! Do not listen to this dunderhead of a clod here! I am in no way jealo—
Goodness, your face is very red. Do you have a fever?
...Huh?
Tsk! And your forehead is terrifically hot! Dear me, but I fear you may have caught Prince Euden's cold.
I'm so sorry; I should have been more careful to ensure his germs did not spread.
N-no! I haven't caught his cold at a—
If it isn't a cold, then it may be something far more serious.
Now then, you must tell me everything. How long have you had these symptoms?
Umm...
Hell, I can answer that one for ya! It all started 'round the time she first met ol' Euden.
Silence yourself, sir!
That long? This is worse than I thought. Come with me at once; I need you to tell me everything about your condition while I perform a thorough exam.
I am NOT sick!
Ah, that's what all sick people say. And yet, we never are as good at diagnosing ourselves as we think.
Now come! I need you to tell me every last detail!
I refuse! ...Argh! No! Stop yanking me!
I'll get you for this, Ranzaaaaal!
...Wow, these fever dreams are intense. I swear I just heard Elly screaming.
Then you better get back to sleep pronto, unless you want Aeleen coming back in here with another cold thermometer!
Tweeeet...
All right, let's give this a try. I need to point the mana I've gathered outward...
That's right. Just relax and focus the mind on who you are healing.
...There!
Oh!
Tweet?
Oh! His wings are healed!
Tweet tweet tweeeet!
Congratulations on your first successful healing.
I really did it! Oh, I'm so happy!
That's another step closer to being a full-fledged nurse. ...Er, right?
Indeed. Now you just need to increase your success rate and make yourself ever more dependable.
Thank you for teaching me, Cleo.
Is it true you can use healing magic now, Aeleen? That's great!
I owe it all to Cleo for being such a good teacher.
Hold on a moment... Are you hurt, Prince Euden?
Er, I don't think so?
Yes, of course. ...Well, if you ever ARE, know that I'll be more than happy to set your ailments to rights.
We'll be counting on it.
I'm going to study hard and become the finest nurse in the land!
Gaaah... Owwww... I tell ya, Sarisse's body blows get more deadly by the day.
ARE YOU INJURED?!
What, this? Nah, this is just more of a... Well, somethin' I'm used to, I guess.
Oh. Well, that's good. Er, but if you ever ARE injured, come to me!
You got it. And thanks for the concern! ...Er, that WAS concern, right?
I can't believe it's taken me this long to notice you were fraying.
But don't worry, Matilda; as soon as I'm done sewing you back up, I'll give you all the snuggles in the wor—OW!
ARE YOU INJURED?!
Hello, Aeleen. No, I'm fine.
You pricked yourself with a sewing needle! You need painkillers! Iodine! Bandages!
It was just a simple pinprick. I'm not even bleeding.
Ah. Y-yes, of course.
Aeleen, how long have you been standing outside my door?
Oh, from right around the time you said, ＂But don't worry, Matilda; as soon as I'm done sewing you back up, I'll give you all the snuggles in the wor—OW!＂
Aaaargh!
Urgh... The pain...
ARE YOU INJURED?!
Uuurgh... Just ate too much for dinner... Well, technically it was second dinner... Plus an early breakfast... And snacks...
Well, that's not helpful at all!
Er, SHOULD it be helpful? ...Wait, where ya goin'?!
Okay, so I was taking a nap earlier and sorta fell off the desk. ...Don't laugh.
Anyway, Aeleen comes running to see if I'm hurt, but when I tell her that I'm fine, she gets all huffy and leaves!
Heh. I suppose it's normal to want to make use of a new skill.
Anyway, do you want me to read you the rest of that faerie tale we started earlier?
Do I ever! Crack that sucker open like an egg in a hammer store!
I'm going to take that as a yes. Now where were we...?
Ow!
Oh man, paper cuts are the wors—
ARE YOU INJURED?!
EEEEEEEEEK!
Oh, I'm sorry! I didn't mean to scare you! I just heard someone cry out in pain and rushed in to see if I could help.
Er, I just cut my finger on the edge of one of the pages here.
It's even bleeding a little.
Yesssss! It IS bleeding!
You sound weirdly happy about that.
What? Of course not! I would never be happy to see someone hurt!
But now that I've finally met someone who's really injured, I'm so... *sniff*
Give me your hand and let me heal you, Prince Euden.
Er, all right.
(Heh. I don't think she's aware of how she's coming across to everyone.)
Right. First, I need to focus on the mana around me and harmonize with it...
(Well, whatever makes her happy.)
Then I need to point the mana I've gathered outwards...
Relax... Focus my mind...
Whew! We're finally here...
You can't let yourself be tired yet; our work has only begun!
I can't believe you have so much energy. We've been fighting for days without end, yet you're spending all of your downtime tending to the sick and wounded.
I just want to help people.
Oh, I'd say you're doing that. In fact, I'd say you're working above and beyond what your average nurse would do by making your own medicine and such.
Well, many small towns and villages don't have doctors or healing-magic users.
And those are the people I want to help, even if it isn't technically within my job description.
Now then, are you ready to get moving? I have to deliver this medicine, stat!
Thank you, Aeleen! This should have my wife back to her old self again!
I'm glad to hear it. Please tell her that I would love to see her again.
Thank you for helping me before, Aeleen. Oh, but lately I've had this strange cough...
Here, let me give you something for it.
Wow, everyone really seems to love you. You have so many patients now!
＂Love＂ is probably a little much. I'm just trying to help.
Yeah! Why would anyone love someone like her?
Don't talk to the nurse like that!
I'm so sorry for his behavior, Aeleen. He loves you—he's simply too shy to admit it.
No I DON'T!
Oh dear, someone seems to hate me. Did you take the medicine I gave you?
No way! It tastes TERRIBLE!
I'm sorry. I've tried everything, but he simply refuses to take it.
You shouldn't cause such trouble for your poor mother, child.
If you refuse to take your medicine, you're only going to get sick again.
I won't take anything YOU give me!
Hmm... This is a tough one.
Well, well, well! If it ain't the lady what's passin' out free goodies.
Yer the one givin' folks medicine, yeah?
I am. What of it?
Give it here.
Right?! We deserve it much as anyone! Plus, uh... Oooo! My stomach!
Sounds like SOMEONE needs medicine! Now hand it over, lady!
Let me take care of this, Aeleen.
I have this under control, thank you. Now let me see what I have to deal with that stomach issue of yours...
Don't give them anything!
Yeah, these guys are nothing but crooks! They've been stealing our medicine and selling it on the black market for ages!
They...steal medicine?
Shoulda kept yer mouths shut... Now YER gonna need medicine!
You are terrible! The people here are doing their best to fight their illnesses, and you would seek to PROFIT from that?!
Shut up and make with the goods, lady!
Unless you wanna be dippin' into your own supply once we work ya over!
St-stay back!
Get away from her!
Get lost, punk!
Are you crazy?! Put that knife away! There are children everywhere!
Go on and grab the goodies! I'll carve this one up reeeal nice...
Bwaaa ha ha! Sure thing, boss!
N-no! Please, stay back!
Stay away from her!
No! Come back!
Don't do it!
Looks like we got us a brave little brat. Get lost, kid!
Eeek!
...Huh? I'm...okay?
Huh?!
The hell is up with this dame? Let go'a me already!
Nurses don't just save lives... Some of us also take them.
EEEEK!
What are you waitin' for?! Get this dame already!
Let's see how much you talk when I CRACK YOUR FACE OPEN LIKE A FREAKIN' WALNUT!
Eeeek!
This one's CRAZY!
W-we're gettin' outta here! NOW!
Eeeeek! Waaaait for meeeeee!
Are you all right, Aeleen?
...I did it again.
Yeah, you did. But you ALSO drove those thugs off without anyone getting hurt.
I suppose that's good. But...
But now everyone is terrified of me.
Oh...
I'm sorry. I know that was scary. Can you stand on your own?
Eeeeek! I'm fine!
That's good. I'm going to give you some more medicine—so make sure to drink it this time, all right?
Y-yes, ma'am! Right away, ma'am! *glug* *glug* *glug*
Mmmm! S-sooo...tasty...
Now please don't hurt me! Pleeeeease!
Come back!
Wait! You don't have to run from... *sigh*
Well, at least you got him to take his medicine, right?
I mean, that's SOMETHING.
This is hardly how I dreamed my career as a nurse would play out.
Did I actually say I'd crack someone's head open like a WALNUT?
Everyone, wait! Let's start over! I can be kiiiind!
Did you hear about how Aeleen drove all those villains away with just a glare?
Hear it? I SAW it! She had crazy eyes, so she did. I've never seen the like!
I don't wanna take my medicine!
If you don't, Aeleen will make you!
EEEEK! I'll take it! I'll taaaake it!
Yep. Sounds like Aeleen is REAL popular in that village.
Not sure popular is the word I'd use.
But it ain't like they hate her, exactly. I mean, there's worse things to be than the ＂nurse of nightmares＂ what ya don't wanna be pissin' off.
I doubt she feels the same.
*sniff*
(Wait, was that Aeleen?)
*sigh*
I can't believe that's how people are talking about what happened.
Though I probably shouldn't be surprised; it's normal to be shocked by what I did. I mean, I'm rather shocked myself.
*sigh* I need to go to the village to do my usual rounds, but I just...
Maybe I should take a day off.
Do you have a moment, Aeleen?
Yes, of course. What is it?
Sorry for showing up unannounced. Are you busy?
It's fine. How can I help?
Well, when I was training with Ranzal yesterday, I fell and hit my arm.
Goodness, that's a serious bruise! You should have shown me this earlier.
It honestly didn't seem so bad yesterday, but when I woke up this morning, it was... Well, let's call it colorful. Anyway, do you think you can take a look at it?
Of course!
Thanks.
...All right, I'm finished.
You really need to take better care of yourself, you know?
Yeah, I know. I've always been bad about tending to myself ever since I was a kid. Zethia used to take care of me like you're doing now.
She's your sister, right?
Yes. She would follow me everywhere, insisting it was her job to heal me.
I suppose everyone dreams of being able to help others when they're young.
Maybe so. Speaking of which, was that what made you want to be a nurse to begin with?
Well...
My hometown is far to the north, in a region of heavy snow.
We didn't have anyone who knew the first thing about healing magic.
So when the roads were blocked by snow—which happened often—getting sick or injured often spelled death.
Snow is always pretty from a distance, but it's easy to forget how hard it can be for the people who live with it.
You're right about that. But one day, a nurse came from out of town.
She built a small hospital for us that changed everything.
She was kind, devoted, and always happy. Soon, illness was no longer the death sentence it used to be.
I looked up to her, and dreamed of being like that one day myself.
And that set you down this path?
It's almost too straightforward a reason.
Still, as much as I want to be like her, it seems that will never happen.
Why not?
Because at the slightest provocation, I turn into my other self—as with those bandits the other day.
Our nurse was the embodiment of kindness, but I never will be.
I think you're doing perfectly fine.
Did you not see how horrified everyone was at my actions?
They will never think of me as a kindly healing goddess now.
A goddess, eh?
Aeleen, did you look up to that nurse just because you wanted to be a ＂kindly healing goddess＂?
W-well...
I don't think that's the case.
I think it was because she helped lift the specter of death that hung over your village and its people.
Now that you mention it...
You might not be able to become exactly like that nurse—but that's because you're NOT her. People are all different.
But even if you don't have her personality, isn't it enough to become a nurse who helps people as she did?
No, you're right.
You're absolutely right.
All this time, I've been so focused on becoming her that I lost sight of why I started feeling that way in the first place.
I need to focus on trying to be more like her in my deeds, not her doppelganger.
I know you can do it.
Thank you for helping me realize all of this, Prince Euden.
Excuse me, Aeleen?
Some people from a nearby village came to inquire about why their usual nurse hadn't come to visit. They're quite worried.
They did? Really?
They're waiting outside the gate. Would you mind going to see them?
Of course!
Prince Euden, I...
It seems someone sees you the way you saw the nurse from your childhood.
I truly hope so.
(I'm glad everything worked out, Aeleen.)
Er, by the way, I suppose I have no reason to keep this from you, so...
Hmm? What is it?
A few of the patients who came today seem to be rather...frightened.
They believe they have angered Aeleen, yet want her help so badly they practically begged me to go find her.
Let's maybe not tell Aeleen that bit.
